Key Match Events: Lassine Sinayoko scored his team's second goal
Edmond Tapsoba scored an own goal early in the match
Bertrand Traore reduced arrears from a penalty
Issoufou Dayo's goal was ruled offside
Post-Match Reflections: Sinayoko said they can celebrate the victory but acknowledged there is still much work ahead
Burkina Faso coach Hubert Velud brought on Dango Ouattara for Traore with 13 minutes of regular time remaining
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match in Korhogo, Ivory Coast, kicked off in 36 degrees Celsius (97 Fahrenheit) heat
Mali made six changes from the side that drew 0-0 with Namibia
Burkina Faso changed four of the side beaten 2-0 by Angola
This was only the second Cup of Nations meeting between Mali and Burkina Faso
